TEXT: The applicants , whose particulars appear in the appendix , are represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE and by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . The respondent Government were represented by their Agent , PERSON to whom PERSON succeeded on DATE .
The application of Mr PERSON was lodged on DATE . The remaining applicants introduced their applications on DATE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
On DATE private limited companies ILaS Vranov , ORG . and PERSON , ORG . concluded a contract under which the former undertook to sell real property to the latter .
The circumstances under which the contract was concluded are contested between the parties .

The Government submit that the applicants had personal links to the above companies and that they had pecuniary interests in them . In particular , both companies were subsidiaries of the company Topex and were controlled by PERSON . The Government express the view that the contract was actually drafted at DATE than indicated in it .
The applicants refute the ORG ’s allegation that the date of the contract had been forged .

On DATE the tax administration authority issued a pledge in respect of the above real property with a view to securing a tax debt which the company ILaS Vranov , ORG . possibly had . The representatives of the company attempted to have the decision lifted arguing that the company owed no taxes . On DATE the tax authority quashed its decision of CARDINAL DATE . On DATE , it issued an interim measure preventing the company from alienating the property on the ground that tax control was being carried out in the company . Subsequently the competent authorities found that the company had no tax debt .

As a result of the interference of the tax authority , the company ILaS Vranov , ORG . was not in a position to comply with the above contract and owed a considerable contractual penalty to its partner . Its representatives filed a claim for damages , under LAW of DATE , against the ORG , represented by ORG .

On DATE the Vranov nad Topľou District Court granted the claim and ordered the defendant to pay CARDINAL.CARDINAL.CARDINAL NORP korunas ( SKK ) to the plaintiff . The court established that the tax authority had proceeded erroneously and had thus caused damage to the plaintiff .

On DATE the ORG upheld ORG conclusion considering that the tax authority had proceeded contrary to the law . The appellate court reduced the sum granted to the plaintiff to SKK CARDINAL.CARDINAL.CARDINAL plus default interest . The decision became final on DATE and enforceable on DATE . The defendant filed an appeal on points of law . ORG rejected it as being inadmissible on DATE .
As ORG failed to comply with the judgment , PERSON , ORG . sought its enforcement .
On DATE a judge of the Vranov nad Topľou District Court authorised an execution officer to enforce the sum in question .
On DATE the enforcement officer notified ORG of the enforcement and invited it to pay the debt within DATE . ORG filed objections to the enforcement . They were dismissed by the Vranov ORG on DATE .
On DATE ILaS ORG transferred the title to the above sum to the company ORG .- C.D. , a.s . The Vranov ORG approved of this transfer by a decision of CARDINAL DATE .

On DATE the Vranov nad Topľou District Court granted the execution officer ’s request and authorised her to avail herself of securities in possession of the ORG with a view to enforcing the sum in question . Reference was made to Sections CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW of DATE . The decision stated , with reference to the relevant provisions of LAW , that the execution officer enjoyed all rights relating to the securities .

ORG filed an extraordinary appeal on points of law against this decision . ORG dismissed it on DATE . In ORG view , the execution officer had been authorised to enforce the sum due by having the securities sold . The decision further stated that even if the decision challenged by ORG was quashed , it would not affect the execution procedure as such . ORG did not , therefore , examine in detail the arguments adduced by ORG .

In the meantime , the execution officer concluded a contract with a private company specialised in trading in securities with a view to having the securities specified in the execution order sold . On the basis of this contract and the judicial authorisation to carry out the enforcement , a representative of the company commissioned by the execution officer arranged , at FAC ( GPE cenných papierov SR Bratislava , a.s . ) , for the sale to the applicants of shares of Transpetrol , a.s . , a joint stock company in which the sole shareholder was ORG . The operation was carried out on DATE .
On DATE company ORG .- C.D. , a.s . concluded contracts of pledge in respect of the securities with GPE , a.s . , GPE , a.s . , ORG , a.s . , ORG , ORG . , Mr PERSON and Mr ORG .
On DATE the execution officer returned the authorisation to carry out the execution to the Vranov ORG with the explanation that the sum due had been enforced .

The representatives of ORG , a.s . and of ORG challenged the transfer of the shares on the ground that it had been carried out without the approval of the issuer of the securities . On DATE the ORG therefore ordered that trading with the securities of Transpetrol , a.s . be suspended . On DATE , after the relevant documents had been checked , the ORG lifted the order .

On DATE ORG ordered ORG , with reference to LAW of DATE , to transfer the shares which the applicants had acquired back to ORG within DATE . The decision stated that ORG had acted erroneously . In particular , ORG had transferred the securities without prior consent of the owner , and there was a contradiction between the operative part of the court ’s decision authorising the execution officer to carry out the enforcement and the reasons for that decision . Furthermore , the relevant documents indicated that the enforcement should have concerned ORG and not ORG , and that under the relevant law the securities in question could only be owned by the ORG . Lastly , the decision stated that it could be challenged by means of a remedy ( rozklad ) to be lodged with ORG within DATE after its service . It was not served on the applicants and became final on DATE .
On DATE the ORG informed the applicants that it had complied with the order of ORG and that , as a result , they no longer owned the shares of Transpetrol , a.s .
On DATE Transpetrol , a.s . modified the form of its securities . As a result , the shares ceased to be registered at ORG .
ORG refused to give an explanation to the applicants on the ground that they were not parties to the administrative proceedings leading to the decision of CARDINAL DATE .
On DATE ORG informed the applicants that public prosecutors had no power to review the way in which ORG had proceeded .

The applicants , with the exception of ORG , ORG . , requested ORG to review the lawfulness of the decision of ORG of DATE . By CARDINAL decisions delivered on CARDINAL and CARDINAL DATE respectively ORG discontinued the proceedings in respect of the claims lodged by ORG , a.s . , GPE , a.s . , Mr PERSON and GPE , a.s . as the plaintiffs had not challenged the administrative decision complained of by means of a remedy ( rozklad ) before ORG . ORG considered irrelevant that the decision of DATE had not been served on the plaintiffs as it was obvious from their submissions that they had been aware of it . Furthermore , the plaintiffs could have requested the administrative authority concerned to grant them the status of parties to the proceedings . Under the relevant provisions of LAW , the administrative authority was obliged to decide on such a request and its decision could be challenged . ORG decided in camera without having summoned the plaintiffs .

By a decision delivered on DATE a different chamber of ORG discontinued the proceedings in respect of the claim lodged by Mr PERSON . The decision stated that the court lacked jurisdiction to deal with the case . ORG further held that the decision delivered by ORG on DATE had not directly determined the plaintiff ’s rights and that the latter had not been a party to the proceedings in the context of which the decision had been delivered . ORG therefore found no reason for proceeding pursuant to Secton CARDINALb(CARDINAL ) of ORG .

On DATE a different chamber of ORG discontinued the proceedings in respect of the claim lodged by Mr T. Kolesár on the ground that he had failed to pay the court fees before DATE as requested by the court . The decision was served on DATE . In the meantime , on DATE , the plaintiff had paid the fees . He therefore requested ORG , on DATE , that the proceedings be resumed . ORG did not proceed with the case .

In DATE the applicants filed both an ordinary and an extraordinary remedy against the decision delivered by ORG on DATE . They claimed , in particular , that administrative authorities lacked jurisdiction to determine ownership rights in respect of securities . The applicants also requested that they should be granted the standing of parties to the proceedings in which the contested decision had been delivered .

By decisions of CARDINAL and DATE respectively the Minister of Finance rejected the ORG submissions . The decisions stated that the ordinary remedy was inadmissible as the applicants lacked standing in the administrative proceedings complained of . Furthermore , the contested decision of DATE neither concerned the rights or legally protected interests of the applicants , nor did it directly affect them as the shares had been transferred back to ORG by FAC . As to the applicants’ request that they should be allowed to act as a party to the proceedings , the Minister ’s decisions stated that the applicants should have filed it before the contested decision had become final on DATE .

In the meantime , on DATE , company ORG .- C.D. , a.s . sued its above contractual partners , ORG , a.s . and ORG for the securities pledged . The plaintiff submitted that Transpetrol , a.s . had modified the form of the securities without the creditor ’s knowledge and that it was not known who possessed the securities pledged . On DATE the ORG rejected the action to the extent that it concerned ORG . The proceedings on the claim of company ORG .- C.D. , a.s . of DATE in respect of the other defendants are pending .

On DATE ORG , ORG . filed an action with ORG seeking a judicial review of the above decision delivered by ORG on DATE . The plaintiff argued that the contested decision had not been served on its representatives and that the ORG should have considered it as a party to the proceedings . The plaintiff further argued that decisions concerning the ownership of securities fell within the exclusive jurisdiction of ordinary courts .

On DATE ORG quashed the decision of ORG of DATE and sent the case back to the administrative authority for further proceedings . The decision stated that , despite several requests , the defendant ORG had failed to comply with its statutory obligation to submit the administrative file concerning the case to ORG . Without having the file before it , ORG was not in a position to review the lawfulness of the decision complained of .

ORG noted that it was contested between the parties whether or not the plaintiff was a party to the administrative proceedings in question . It recalled that administrative authorities were obliged to examine , of their own initiative and throughout the administrative proceedings , whether a person has standing in the proceedings . When such was not the case , the administrative authority had to issue a formal decision to that effect . ORG concluded that ORG should have delivered a formal decision in case that it considered that the plaintiff was not a party to the proceedings in question . The delivery of such a decision would have allowed the plaintiff company to avail itself of its procedural rights with a view to protecting its interests .

On DATE the ORG filed an extra - ordinary appeal on points of law against ORG judgment of CARDINAL DATE on the ground that ORG , ORG . lacked standing in the administrative proceedings complained of and that ORG had committed errors of law . On DATE ORG asked the representative of ORG , ORG . to submit comments on the submissions of ORG .

On DATE the applicants requested ORG ( PERSON pre finančný trh ) , which had taken over the role of supervisor of the financial market operations in the meantime , to order ORG to restore the securities in question to their accounts in accordance with the situation existing prior to DATE .

On DATE the applicants also requested ORG to restore the securities to their accounts with reference to ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE . They were informed that ORG could not to take any action without a prior decision of ORG .
On DATE the applicants filed an action with ORG , under LAW , claiming that ORG had failed to decide on their request of DATE .

On DATE a public prosecutor indicted the representative of ORG a.s . , CARDINAL representatives of PERSON . , the Vranov nad Topľou District Court judge and the execution officer involved in the above execution as well as an employee of ORG and a broker for several offences before the ORG .
On DATE ORG decided that the case was to be dealt with by ORG .

On DATE ORG discontinued the proceedings against the Vranov nad Topľou District Court judge as there was no indication that she had committed an offence . According to the Government , the proceedings against the other accused are pending .

Pursuant to Article CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) , owners have the right to protection against unjustified interference with their ownership rights by others . In particular , they are entitled to claim the restoration of the property from those who hold it without any valid legal ground .

In accordance with the established practice , a plaintiff claiming protection of ownership rights can only be successful , when it is proved that he or she is the owner of the property in question and that the defendant has held the property without any valid legal ground .

Article PERSON ) provides that judicial proceedings can be brought with a view to having the existence of a right or of a legal relation determined provided that it is justified by a pressing legal interest .

Article CARDINAL provides that in administrative judiciary courts review the lawfulness of administrative decisions which determine rights and obligations of individuals or legal persons . As from DATE , this provision has been amended in that courts are also entitled to review the way in which administrative authorities proceed including their failure to act .

Pursuant to Article CARDINAL ) , courts are entitled to decide on actions against decisions delivered by administrative authorities where such decisions have become final after the exhaustion of all ordinary remedies .

Article CARDINAL ) provides that plaintiffs in proceedings concerning the review of an administrative decision can be individuals or legal persons who allege , as parties to the administrative proceedings , that their rights were infringed as a result of the administrative authority ’s decision . Action for a judicial review of an administrative decision can also be lodged by individuals or legal persons whom the administrative authority did not consider to be parties to administrative proceedings where such persons should have been considered as parties .

DATE ) provides that , where the action is lodged by a person alleging that the administrative decision has not been served on him or her despite the fact that he or she should have been considered as a party to administrative proceedings , the court shall verify such an allegation and , where justified , order the administrative authority to serve the decision on the person concerned . According to the circumstances , the court shall also order that the enforceability of such a decision be delayed . The decision of the court is binding on the administrative authority . After the service of the decision in question the administrative authority shall transmit the case file to the court which shall decide on the action .

Article CARDINALb ( CARDINAL ) , enacted with effect from DATE , provides that courts shall not proceed in accordance with the procedure set out in DATE ) where DATE elapsed from the delivery of the administrative decision which was not served on a party .

LAW ) and ( CARDINAL ) , as in force since DATE , provides that natural and legal persons who consider that an administrative authority failed to proceed with a case without any valid reason can request a court to order the administrative authority to proceed with the case and to deliver a decision . Where such a request is granted , the court shall set a time - limit , which should not exceed DATE , within which the administrative authority is obliged to decide .

Under LAW , the court can repeatedly impose a fine up to SKK MONEY , at the request of a party to the proceedings , in case that the administrative authority remains inactive despite an earlier judicial order under LAW t .

Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW of DATE ( PERSON o správnom konaní ) admits as parties to administrative proceedings persons whose rights , legally protected interests or obligations are either to be determined or may directly be affected as a result of the proceedings . Any person alleging that the decision may directly affect his or her rights , legally protected interests or obligations shall also be considered a party to administrative proceedings until the opposite is proved .
ORG ) provides that submissions in the context of administrative proceedings can be made either in writing or orally . Oral submissions are to be recorded .
Section CARDINAL of LAW of DATE ( PERSON o súdnych exekútorch a exekučnej činnosti ) excludes the possibility of restitutio in integrum in execution proceedings .
Part CARDINAL of the Execution Order provides for enforcement of a debt by selling securities .
Under Section CARDINAL , upon the authorisation of the court the execution officer shall take all necessary measures with a view to maintaining or carrying out the rights relating to securities .
Section CARDINAL provides that the execution officer shall satisfy the creditor ’s claim by measures which are appropriate to the nature of the securities in question .

Pursuant to LAW of DATE ( PERSON o cenných papieroch , LAW . DATE ) , unless the law otherwise provides , the buyer becomes owner of a security even in cases when the vendor had no right to transfer such a security with the exception of cases where the buyer was aware of this fact at the time of the transfer .
Under LAW , ORG carries out ORG supervision over , inter alia , the trading with securities and ORG .

When ORG finds that a person under its supervision failed to comply with LAW or other legal rules , it is entitled , pursuant to LAW ) , to order that measures be taken with a view to remedying the shortcomings found .

Section CARDINAL of LAW of DATE ( PERSON o cenných papieroch a investičných službách a o zmene a doplnení niektorých zákonov , Act No . ORG ) provides that supervision of activities within the meaning of this LAW comprises , among others , the activities of issuers , central depositors and dealers with securities . The supervision is carried out by an office established for that purpose .

Under LAW , this LAW governs legal relations established prior to its entry into force . However , the establishment of such relations and claims resulting therefrom which arose prior to the entry into force of the LAW are to be assessed under the previously existing legal rules unless this LAW otherwise provides .

Act No . CARDINAL/CARDINAL on Supervision of the Financial Market and LAW provides in LAW for establishment of an office with legal personality . The office is entitled to carry out supervision under the relevant law .

Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL)(a ) provides that the office supervises the activities of , inter alia , dealers with securities , of the stock - exchange , of the securities central depository and , to the extent specified by law , of other persons active on the capital market . Such supervision comprises control of compliance with the relevant law , conduct of proceedings under the relevant law , delivery of authorisations and other decisions provided for by the law and control of compliance with the decisions delivered by the office .
Act No . CARDINAL/CARDINAL amended the provisions of LAW to Other Persons . It entered into force on DATE .

Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) provides , inter alia , that the company Transpetrol , a.s . can be denationalised only to such an extent that the ORG remains the owner of CARDINAL CARDINAL per cent of its shares .

Pursuant to LAW , as in force until DATE , ORG decided on complaints concerning final decisions made by , inter alia , local government authorities and local self - governing bodies in cases concerning violations of the fundamental rights and freedoms of citizens , unless the protection of such rights fell under the jurisdiction of another court .

Pursuant to Article CARDINAL ) of the LAW , as in force until DATE , ORG could commence proceedings upon a petition ( “ podnet ” ) presented by any individual or corporation claiming that their rights had been violated . According to its case - law under the former Article CARDINAL ) of the LAW , ORG lacked jurisdiction to draw legal consequences from a violation of a petitioner ’s rights . It could neither grant damages to the person concerned nor impose a sanction on the public authority liable for the violation found . In ORG view , it was therefore for the authority concerned to provide redress to the person whose rights were violated .

With effect from DATE , the LAW has been amended in that , inter alia , individuals and legal persons can complain about a violation of their fundamental rights and freedoms pursuant to LAW which reads as follows :

“ CARDINAL . The Constitutional Court shall decide on complaints lodged by natural or legal persons alleging a violation of their fundamental rights or freedoms or of human rights and fundamental freedoms enshrined in international treaties ratified by GPE ... unless the protection of such rights and freedoms falls within the jurisdiction of a different court .

CARDINAL . When the Constitutional Court finds that a complaint is justified , it shall deliver a decision stating that a person ’s rights or freedoms set out in paragraph CARDINAL have been violated as a result of a final decision , by a particular measure or by means of any other interference . It shall quash such a decision , measure or other interference . When the violation found is the result of a failure to act , ORG may order that [ the authority ] which violated such rights or freedoms shall take the necessary action . At the same time ORG may return the case to the authority concerned for further proceedings , order that such an authority abstain from violating fundamental rights and freedoms ... or , where appropriate , order that those who violated the rights or freedoms set out in paragraph CARDINAL restore the situation to that existing prior to the violation .
CARDINAL . In its decision on a complaint ORG may grant adequate financial satisfaction to the person whose rights under paragraph CARDINAL have been violated . ” ...

Section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of Act No . TIME on the liability of the ORG for damage caused by a ORG organ ’s decision or by its erroneous official action ( ORG o zodpovednosti za škodu spôsobenú rozhodnutím orgánu štátu alebo jeho nesprávnym úradným postupom - “ LAW ” ) provides that the ORG is liable for damage caused by unlawful decisions delivered by a public authority in the context of , inter alia , civil proceedings .

Section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) renders the ORG liable for damage caused in the context of carrying out functions vested in public authorities which results from erroneous official actions of persons entrusted with the exercise of these functions . A claim for compensation can be granted when the plaintiff shows that he or she suffered damage as a result of an erroneous action of a public authority , quantifies its amount , and shows that there is a causal link between the damage and the erroneous action in question .
